steps.name: Application Submission
steps.description: Submit application documents to HTW Dresden
steps.deadline: 15 June for winter semester and 15 November for summer semester

steps.name: Application Review
steps.description: Review of application documents by HTW Dresden

steps.name: Research English taught courses
steps.description: Browse the HTW Dresden website for English taught courses

steps.name: Select courses
steps.description: Choose desired English taught courses

phases.name: Academic Coordinator / Learning Agreement / study schedule

steps.name: Create Learning Agreement
steps.description: Fill out the Learning Agreement digitally via https://learning-agreement.eu or use the template for non-Erasmus+ students.
steps.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Submit Learning Agreement for approval
steps.description: Submit the Learning Agreement to your home university and HTWD for approval.
steps.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Receive approval confirmation
steps.description: Get confirmation that your Learning Agreement has been approved by your home university and HTWD.
steps.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Step 1: Check Academic Calendar
steps.description: Students check the academic calendar for the upcoming semester.

steps.name: Step 2: Plan Study Schedule
steps.description: Students plan their study schedule for the semester.
steps.deadline: Before the start of the semester

steps.name: Attend Information Sessions
steps.description: Attend the information sessions during the Welcome Week.

steps.name: Enroll in Language Course
steps.description: Enroll in the language course of your choice.

steps.name: Obtain Health Insurance
steps.description: Students from outside EU or EEA countries must take out a German health insurance.

steps.name: Check immigration formalities
steps.description: Check the immigration formalities available from the Federal Foreign Office and the German missions in your home country.

steps.name: Obtain passport
steps.description: Obtain a passport if you don't have one.

steps.name: Arrange insurance and permits
steps.description: Arrange insurance and the necessary permits before leaving your home country.

steps.name: Apply for visa
steps.description: Apply for a student visa at the German embassy in your home country if you are a non-EU citizen and plan to stay in Germany for more than three months.
steps.deadline: Several weeks/month before your planned departure

steps.name: Register for student residence
steps.description: Use the online application procedure to register for a student residence.

steps.name: Pay Semester Contribution
steps.description: Exchange students need to pay the semester contribution by bank transfer from their home country before entering the country.
enables: Receive HTW student card and HTW-Login

steps.name: Registration at the International Office
steps.description: Students need to register at the International Office.
enables: Information session on the organisation of your studies and the selection of your courses

steps.name: Enrolment
steps.description: Enrol at the International Office

required_documents.name: Proof of Health Insurance Recognized in Germany

steps.name: Receive student card
steps.description: Get the student card at the beginning of studies

steps.name: Accessing the digital ticket
steps.description: Log in to the platform using university login to access the semester ticket
steps.deadline: 01.03. until 31.08." for summer semester and "01.09. until 28./29.02." for winter semester"

phases.name: Registration at the Citizens’ Office Dresden

steps.name: Make an online appointment
steps.description: Book an appointment at the Citizens' Office Dresden

steps.name: Visit the Citizens' Office
steps.description: Register at the local Citizens' Office Dresden
steps.deadline: Within two weeks if staying longer than 3 months

steps.name: Submit required documents
steps.description: Provide passport, identification card, rental contract, and Landlord's certificate/housing confirmation

steps.name: Make an appointment
steps.description: Send required information to the Immigration Office Dresden to schedule an appointment.

steps.name: Submit application and documents
steps.description: Hand in the residence permit application and required documents at the Immigration Authority.
steps.deadline: Within the first three months after entering Germany

dependencies.description: Required documents and information for the application.

steps.name: Open a German bank account
steps.description: Students need to open a German bank account to debit the rent.
enables: Receive a debit card and cash card

phases.name: Timetable / start of the lecture period

steps.name: Check Timetable
steps.description: Check the published timetable for the semester
steps.deadline: Beginning of March for summer semester, mid September for winter semester

steps.name: Plan Lectures
steps.description: Plan your lectures schedule
steps.deadline: Before the start of the semester

steps.name: Enter Course Code
steps.description: Enter your course code for additional courses
steps.deadline: Before the start of the semester

steps.name: Get Individual Timetable
steps.description: Get your individual timetable for the semester
steps.deadline: Before the start of the semester

phases.name: HTWD student Login and digital tools (eduroam, OPAL, HTW email...)

steps.name: Enroll at the International Office
steps.description: Receive your personal HTWD Login

steps.name: Access student account
steps.description: Log in to student computers, student web, library's resources, and HTWD email account

steps.name: Access digital tools
steps.description: Use digital tools, systems, and programs for studies

phases.name: Timetable (start / end of the course / break times)

steps.name: Check Timetable
steps.description: Check the 3rd double period options for the lunch break.
steps.deadline: Before the start of the course

phases.name: Room names and locations on the HTWD campus

steps.name: Step 1: Find Room Location
steps.description: Determine the location of the room based on the letter and digits provided.

steps.name: Register for Exams
steps.description: Send current learning agreement to International Office

steps.name: Get Exam Dates
steps.description: Check for published examination dates
steps.deadline: One month before the start of the respective examination section

steps.name: Deregister from Exam
steps.description: Withdraw from an examination up to one week before the examination

steps.name: Wait for grades to be reported
steps.description: Wait for all grades to be reported by professors/lecturers to the Examination Office.
steps.deadline: 4 weeks after the official end of the examination period

steps.name: Request Transcript of Records
steps.description: Contact the Examination Office to request the Transcript of Records after waiting for 4 weeks.

steps.name: Confer with home university and Academic Coordinator
steps.description: Discuss the prolongation of matriculation with home university and Academic Coordinator
enables: Obtain the form for prolongation of matriculation

steps.name: Obtain the form for prolongation of matriculation
steps.description: Get the form from the Academic Coordinator
requires: Confer with home university and Academic Coordinator

steps.name: Sign the form
steps.description: Sign the form along with your home university and Academic Coordinator
requires: Obtain the form for prolongation of matriculation

steps.name: Complete a new Learning Agreement
steps.description: Finish a new Learning Agreement
enables: Hand in the signed prolongation of matriculation

steps.name: Hand in the signed prolongation of matriculation
steps.description: Submit the signed form at the International Office
enables: Get a letter of admission for the following semester

steps.name: Re-register for the next semester
steps.description: Pay the semester contribution and update the student ID card

phases.name: Career Service at HTWD - Scouting SN

steps.name: Application Preparation
steps.description: Prepare application documents and CV

steps.name: Job Search
steps.description: Search for job openings and apply

steps.name: Interview Preparation
steps.description: Prepare for interviews with coaching and advice

steps.name: Determine country of origin
steps.description: Identify the country of origin to determine working hours

steps.name: Check EU/EEA/Switzerland/Norway/Liechtenstein status
steps.description: Determine if the student is from the EU, EEA, Switzerland, Norway, or Liechtenstein
enables: Work more than 20 hours without permission

steps.name: Work more than 20 hours without permission
steps.description: Students from the EU, EEA, Switzerland, Norway, or Liechtenstein can work more than 20 hours without special permission

steps.name: Make insurance contributions
steps.description: Students who work more than 20 hours must make insurance contributions
requires: Work more than 20 hours without permission
enables: Work more than 140 days without permission

steps.name: Work more than 140 days without permission
steps.description: Students from everywhere else can work more than 140 days without special permission

steps.name: Apply for special permission
steps.description: Students from everywhere else need special permission to work more than 140 days
requires: Work more than 140 days without permission
enables: Work more than 140 days with permission

steps.name: Work more than 140 days with permission
steps.description: Students can work more than 140 days with special permission

steps.name: Find a doctor
steps.description: Search for a doctor who speaks your native language in Dresden.

steps.name: Make an appointment
steps.description: Schedule a visit with the selected doctor.

steps.name: Submit Exmatriculation Form
steps.description: Submit the completed form to the Student Office during office hours.

steps.name: Close German bank account
steps.description: Close your German bank account if you have one.

steps.name: Return borrowed books
steps.description: Return any books you have borrowed to the university library.

steps.name: Deregister from German Health Insurance
steps.description: Deregister from the German Health Insurance with the deregistration certificate from HTW Dresden and the deregistration certificate from the Bürgerbüro (Resident Registration Office Dresden).

steps.name: Deregister from Citizens' Office Dresden
steps.description: De-register from the Citizens' Office Dresden.
steps.deadline: Within two weeks after moving out
